intro: Koelera, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically has velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy coating, and its flowers come in a wide range of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue. Koelera thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care.
